reference.shortdesc:
The refsyn element describes the syntax of something, for example, a command-line utility or an API signature.
Can we be more specific than "something"?

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The refsyn element is specialized from section. It is defined in the reference module.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows how the refsyn element can be used to document the syntax for the Windows mkdir command:
example.codeblock: <refsyn> <title>Syntax</title> <codeblock>mkdir <varname>drive</varname> <varname>directory</varname></codeblock> <parml> <plentry> <pt><varname>drive</varname></pt> <pd>Specifies the drive on which the new directory is created. This is an optional parameter.</pd> </plentry> <plentry> <pt><varname>path</varname></pt> <pd>Specifies the fully-qualified name of the new directory. This is a required parameter.</pd> </plentry> </parml> </refsyn>
